dataset.title: CGR05 Effects of fire frequency on composition of grasshopper assemblages on Konza Prairie LTER Watersheds(1983)

address.deliveryPoint: 116 Ackert Hall, Division of Biology, Kansas State University

section.para: Sweep samples were taken for grasshoppers (Acrididae) at two sites for each of 14 Konza Prairie LTER watersheds. Samples are taken in late July to early August. At each site on each occasion, 10 sets of 20 sweeps (200 sweeps total) are taken. Stored data include for each site on each occasion: total number of each species (all instars combined) collected and total number for each instar for each species (200 sweeps combined).

geographicCoverage.geographicDescription: Riley County, Geary county, Kansas, Konza Prairie Biological Station, KNZ LTER

description.para: For additional methods information see: http://www.konza.ksu.edu/KNZ/docs/MM.pdf

dataTable.entityDescription: Data was recorded on the individual number of each grasshopper species in each sample set. 20 sets were designed at each site and 20 sweeps were taken in each set. This dataset was about the first 10 sets at each sample site.

attribute.attributeDefinition: number of individuals in sample 1 (20 sweeps)
number of individuals in sample 2 (20 sweeps)
number of individuals in sample 3 (20 sweeps)
number of individuals in sample 4 (20 sweeps)
number of individuals in sample 5 (20 sweeps)
number of individuals in sample 6 (20 sweeps)
number of individuals in sample 7 (20 sweeps)
number of individuals in sample 8 (20 sweeps)
number of individuals in sample 9 (20 sweeps)
number of individuals in sample 10 (20 sweeps)
total number of individuals in all samples combined (400 sweeps)

dataTable.entityDescription: Data was recorded on the individual number of each grasshopper species in each set. This dataset was about the set from No.11 to No. 20 at each sample site.

attribute.attributeDefinition: number of individuals in sample 11 (20 sweeps)
number of individuals in sample 12 (20 sweeps)
number of individuals in sample 13 (20 sweeps)
number of individuals in sample 14 (20 sweeps)
number of individuals in sample 15 (20 sweeps)
number of individuals in sample 16 (20 sweeps)
number of individuals in sample 17 (20 sweeps)
number of individuals in sample 18 (20 sweeps)
number of individuals in sample 19 (20 sweeps)
number of individuals in sample 20 (20 sweeps)
total number of individuals in all samples

dataTable.entityDescription: Data was recorded on the individual number of instar and adult stage. Instars were classified into first, second, third, fourth, and fifth stage. Adult was identified with sex (male and female).

attribute.attributeDefinition: number of individuals of adult females
number of individuals of adult males
total number of ind./all stages 400 sweeps
